content.question: Which of the following is equivalent to <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, open parenthesis, 2 times x cubed, plus 1, close parenthesis, squared, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><msup><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, open parenthesis, 4 times x to the sixth power, plus 4 times x cubed, plus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the indefinite integral of, open parenthesis, 2 times x cubed, plus 1, close parenthesis, d x, times, the indefinite integral of, open parenthesis, 2 times x cubed, plus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the indefinite integral of, u squared, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="u equals, 2 times x cubed, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 6 times x squared, end fraction, times the indefinite integral of, u squared, d u" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="u equals, 2 times x cubed, plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>u</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, open parenthesis, 4 times x to the sixth power, plus 4 times x cubed, plus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
